alert.note: Alert for Lehigh; Northampton (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 2:42AM EST until January 10 at 5:00PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... Lehigh River At Walnutport affecting Northampton and Lehigh Counties. For the Lehigh River...including Walnutport...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO LATE THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Lehigh River at Walnutport. * WHEN...From early this morning to late this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, Minor flooding begins downstream at Catasaqua and Hokendaqua. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:30 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 8.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:30 AM EST Wednesday was 8.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 8.5 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage late this morning. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 8.8 feet on 09/09/2011. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (1 am) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Stg Time Date Lehigh River Walnutport 8.0 8.0 Wed 2 am 6.3 5.2 8.5 7am 1/10 &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 245 PM EST.
